description: Heart failure self-management iOS app - offline-first, patient-facing tracker for daily weight, symptoms, and diuretic intake

userStories.title: Project Setup & Tab Navigation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to navigate between the five main sections of the app using a tab bar
acceptanceCriteria: Xcode project created with SwiftUI lifecycle
Minimum deployment target iOS 17.0
TabView with 5 tabs: Today, Trends, Medications, Export, Settings
Each tab has appropriate SF Symbol icon
Tab selection persists during app session

userStories.title: Core Data Model Setup
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the data model to persist daily entries, medications, and alerts on-device
acceptanceCriteria: SwiftData models created: DailyEntry, SymptomEntry, DiureticDose, Medication, AlertEvent
DailyEntry contains date, weight, symptoms array, diuretic doses array
SymptomEntry contains symptom type (enum) and severity (1-5)
Medication contains name, dosage, unit, schedule, isDiuretic flag
Data persists across app launches
Only one DailyEntry per calendar day

userStories.title: Today View - Weight Entry
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to log my daily weight so I can track changes over time
acceptanceCriteria: Weight input field accepts decimal values in pounds
Weight is saved to today's DailyEntry
Shows previous day's weight for reference
Shows weight change from yesterday (+ or - lbs)
Input validates reasonable weight range (50-500 lbs)

userStories.title: Today View - Symptom Logging
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to rate my symptoms on a 1-5 scale so I can track how I'm feeling
acceptanceCriteria: Displays all 8 symptoms: dyspnea at rest, dyspnea on exertion, orthopnea, PND, chest pain, dizziness, syncope, reduced urine output
Each symptom has 1-5 severity selector (1=none, 5=severe)
Symptoms save to today's DailyEntry
Clear visual indication of selected severity
Defaults to 1 (none) for new entries

userStories.title: Medications List Management
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to add and manage my medications so I can track what I'm taking
acceptanceCriteria: Add medication with name, dosage amount, unit, and schedule
Mark medication as diuretic (checkbox/toggle)
List all medications on Medications tab
Edit existing medication
Delete medication with confirmation
Diuretics visually distinguished in list

userStories.title: Today View - Diuretic Logging
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to log when I take my diuretics so I can track my medication adherence
acceptanceCriteria: Shows list of diuretic medications from medication list
Log dose taken with actual dosage amount
Mark dose as 'extra dose' if outside normal schedule
Multiple doses per day supported
Shows doses already logged today

userStories.title: Weight Alert Logic
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to be alerted when my weight increases significantly so I can contact my clinician
acceptanceCriteria: Alert triggers if weight increases ≥2 lbs in 24 hours
Alert triggers if weight increases ≥5 lbs over 7 days
Alert message is warm, non-alarmist, suggests contacting clinician
Alert displayed prominently on Today view
AlertEvent saved to data store

userStories.title: Symptom Severity Alert Logic
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to be alerted when I log severe symptoms so I know to contact my clinician
acceptanceCriteria: Alert triggers if any symptom is logged as 4 or 5
Alert message advises discussing with clinician
Alert is non-prescriptive and reassuring
Alert displayed after saving symptoms

userStories.title: Trends View - Weight Chart
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to see my weight trend over 30 days so I can understand my progress
acceptanceCriteria: Line chart showing daily weight for past 30 days
X-axis shows dates, Y-axis shows weight in lbs
Missing days shown as gaps (not interpolated)
Chart is scrollable/zoomable if needed
Shows current weight and 30-day change summary

userStories.title: Trends View - Symptom Trends
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to see how my symptoms have changed over time
acceptanceCriteria: Shows severity trends for each symptom over 30 days
Raw severity values displayed (no composite scores)
Can toggle individual symptoms on/off
Days with alerts visually marked

userStories.title: PDF Export
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to export my data as a PDF so I can share it with my clinician during visits
acceptanceCriteria: One-tap PDF generation from Export tab
PDF includes: date range, 30-day weight trend, symptom trends, diuretic history, alert events
Optional patient identifier field
Footer disclaimer: 'This summary reflects patient-entered data for self-management and discussion with a clinician.'
Share sheet opens after generation
PDF is readable and professionally formatted

userStories.title: Settings - Basic Preferences
userStories.description: As a user, I want to configure basic app settings
acceptanceCriteria: Setting for daily reminder notification time
Setting for patient name/identifier (optional, for PDF)
About section with version info
Privacy information explaining on-device storage

userStories.title: HealthKit Weight Import
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to import my weight from Apple Health so I don't have to enter it manually
acceptanceCriteria: Request HealthKit authorization for body mass (read-only)
Option to import today's weight from HealthKit
Shows most recent HealthKit weight with timestamp
User can override with manual entry
Graceful handling if HealthKit unavailable

userStories.title: HealthKit Heart Rate Import
userStories.description: As a patient, I want my heart rate data imported from Apple Health for trend tracking
acceptanceCriteria: Request HealthKit authorization for resting heart rate (read-only)
Display resting HR on Today view if available
Heart rate alert: <40 bpm or >120 bpm persistent
Show HR trend on Trends view

userStories.title: Daily Reminder Notification
userStories.description: As a patient, I want a daily reminder to complete my check-in
acceptanceCriteria: Local notification at user-configured time
Notification text is warm and encouraging
Tapping notification opens Today view
Can disable notifications in Settings

userStories.title: Onboarding Flow
userStories.description: As a new user, I want guidance on setting up the app so I can start tracking quickly
acceptanceCriteria: Welcome screen explaining app purpose
HealthKit permission request with explanation
Notification permission request
Prompt to add first medication(s)
Onboarding completes to Today view
Onboarding only shown once

userStories.title: Medication Photo Capture
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to photograph my medication list to help set up my medications
acceptanceCriteria: Camera access to photograph pill bottles or med list
Photos stored locally for reference
User manually enters medications after viewing photo
Optional feature - can skip and enter manually

userStories.title: Dizziness + BP Check Prompt
userStories.description: As a patient logging dizziness, I want a prompt to check my blood pressure if it's not available
acceptanceCriteria: If dizziness ≥3 and no BP data from HealthKit, show prompt
Prompt suggests checking BP manually
If unable to check, advises contacting clinician
Orthostatic precautions mentioned in alert
